title: My Summer Car
notes: No controller support (DFGT Wheel, Xbox Controller, Steam Controller)

title: My Summer Car
notes:
Any mouse movement also adds negative Y mouse movement to the vector. If you move mouse right, it'll be down-right. if you move the mouse left, it'll be down-left. if you move the mouse up, it won't move unless you're moving it fast enough. Controller support doesn't seem to work.

On a fresh save I can get 60fps using GoldenEye graphics settings, along with everything turned on with view distance at max, except for when you're facing certain directions (which is normal) at which point it drops down to about 30. Couldn't see any graphical issues although they may arise when it rains/etc; didn't test.

title: My Summer Car
notes: Any mouse input (mouse movement, mouse buttons, mouse scroll) moves the mouse down. Also, Logitech G27 wheel is not supported.

title: My Summer Car
notes: All good except xbox controller not working

title: My Summer Car
notes: Works perfectly.  The car, not so much

title: My Summer Car
notes: Settings to high, smooth. Keyboard only.

title: My Summer Car
notes: Random FPS drops even on lower resolution and quality

title: My Summer Car
notes: Game runs well. G27 input isn't recognized, but FFB is still functioning.
Works perfect but cursor moving left top corner and that is why it is unplayable.
title: My Summer Car

notes: Everything seems to work as well as it does on Windows, except every input causes the aim to move down and to the right and the game only responds to large, rapid mouse movements, which makes the game nearly unplayable since it requires precise control (this also happens with normal Wine)
title: My Summer Car

notes: 30 fps stable with full screen maximum resolution and golden eye setting. The Y axis always goes to negative, reduced Y sensitivity to 10 reduce the pain.
title: My Summer Car

notes: Runs fine except for a mouse issue. The mouse very slightly moves downwards for every mouse input event. For me at least this was only a minor annoyance, as the game is still perfectly playable if you compensate slightly for the downwards movement while scrolling/clicking/looking to the sides.
title: My Summer Car

notes: Proton 3.7-7beta improved the mouse issues but there is still some drift down and to the right every time there is any mouse input. Reducing the game's mouse sensitivity and increasing DPI/sensitivity in the OS and (if possible) on the mouse itself reduces the drift enough that the game is playable. No controllers are recognized.
title: My Summer Car
